website_summaries.verdict: A good tool for introducing pre-readers to simple words and letter blends. Works best for kids who already recognize most letters.
pros: Phonics-style book geared toward preschool or Kindergarten
Features fun exercises like tracing, mazes, and word searches
Teaches blending sounds and sight words
cons: May not have enough reinforcement for children who can't recognize most letters

customer_reviews.title: A great book to teach your child to read
customer_reviews.text: I'm a homeschool mom with a 6 year old who HATES reading. He loves doung this book!! The first day we got it he completed 11 pages!! It's a very big book with 206 pages. This books builds up to sight words, blended words. I highly recommend this book. I have included pictures of the first lesson my son did.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: This is a great beginning phonics primer to use alongside other methods/games
customer_reviews.text: This is a great beginning phonics primer to use alongside other methods/games. We're doing preschool at home. It's given us a framework for incorporating structured "school" work into play. When we're ready we'll step up to. This is an excellent preschool book or would work well for older reluctant readers.
customer_reviews.author: Beka P

customer_reviews.title: Get rid of the alligator and elephant and it would be perfect.
customer_reviews.text: The best, well thought out beginning phonics book I've seen in a long, long time. The major fault is that the sound for "a" is introduced with "alligator" and the sound for "e" is introduced with "elephant". The "L" after the vowel changes it's sound. "Apple" or "egg". would work a lot better. Otherwise an truly excellent book.
customer_reviews.author: Gretchen Mork

customer_reviews.title: Great learning tool!
customer_reviews.text: My four year old’s birthday was a couple months late for kindergarten public school year. (October) She is eager to learn so we decided to homeschool since I stay home. She already is SOUNDING OUT WORDS on day three. The lessons are two pages and she had fun with them. We average 5 or 6 lessons a day (starting lesson 17 on day 4)... and I’m pleased! She already could write her name and knew her alphabet and some letter sounds but this is even helpful for children learning to identify letters and letter sounds!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth McClamrock

customer_reviews.title: Beginning Readers
customer_reviews.text: My son is almost 6 and struggling to get excited about reading. We have so many Dr. Seuss books and a whole home library of other board books and beginning readers. He took one look at this book and already loves it! We skimmed through it a little together and he is excited to get started! The pictures and lessons are age appropriate for beginning readers. Easy, simple lessons that don't take very long, and different activities sprinkled throughout so it doesn't get boring. This book was also thicker than I thought it would be, good quality pages.
customer_reviews.author: Lacey R.

customer_reviews.title: Not enough engaging with letters
customer_reviews.text: Really not enough attention on each of the letters. It shows maybe two pictures of the letter and moves on to the next letter. Doesn’t even have a whole page to each letter to help engage your child little longer with that letter. Feels like the learning experience is being rushed.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Fun and Easy to Follow
customer_reviews.text: I’m using this workbook to start to teach my 4.5 year old how to read. Unlike other workbooks I’ve tried, this one is easy to follow and entertaining for my son. The lessons are the perfect length to hold his attention and include games and coloring or other activities.
customer_reviews.author: M. Medearis

customer_reviews.title: Great investment
customer_reviews.text: Perfect book to grow with! Fun activities inside. My 3 year old loves it. She knows her phonics already so this was a great way to help advance her skills :)
customer_reviews.author: Svetlana M

customer_reviews.title: Granddaughter is getting ready for school
customer_reviews.text: I brought this book for my granddaughter, who is now starting preschool this year. So far granddaughter and mom is loving the many activities that it has to offer. I'm happy that they are having a wonderful time with this big bright colorful book with lots of fun and learning activities. Thanks to seller and Amazon, I'm very please that I purchase this one because there way so many to choose from. Yes I will be recommending to family and friends thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For 3 or 4 year olds
customer_reviews.text: No writing only mazes and circling the correct letter. Maybe ok for 3 or 4 year olds
customer_reviews.author: macey_may

customer_reviews.title: My son finally reads!
customer_reviews.text: My son finished KG without learning how to read. It was so frustrating to watch him use memory rather than phonemic awareness to try to read. His school really emphasized sight words, so he never paid attention to letters, mixing "and" and "the" and so on. So, after working with word families for several weeks (on my own), I purchased "Learn to Read." It has been amazing!!! My son has been able to blend the sounds so quickly, actually reading, rather than just going off his 45 sight word list from the school. He does about 5-6 lessons per day and we make it into a game after each one. Great buy! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: MommyShopper

customer_reviews.title: Horrible book
customer_reviews.text: Repetitive pages, horrible things to do for the kids. Not worth a single penny. Never buy. Let me explain why. 2 Pages are for each letter. The first page is to tell the parent how to teach, instructing them on ways to teach, what you should tell your kids, how they should write etc. This is not needed. It is a wasted 1 page. The second page is for the kid to do activity. Needless activity. I am stuck with it thanks to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: A. Verma

customer_reviews.title: Homeschool made easy!
customer_reviews.text: I love using this book for my preschooler. It has an easy step-by-step script for parents to introduce the letter and sound on each page. Follow the prompts and there is no prep work. Just open the book and follow the teaching instructions and activities. Quality paper and colorful print. The art and images are cute and well designed. So glad I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Stef9151

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for teaching letter sounds
customer_reviews.text: My Little Guy really likes this book for learning his letters. He is not as interested in learning letters like my other older kids were who kind of naturally took to it and we homeschool so it can be a little frustrating and discouraging for both of us when we just can’t memorize those stinking letters and their sounds. Nothing was penetrating his little mind bc he wasn’t into it... until... this book. We love the method of learning sounds with moving our bodies and I love the simple instructions for me to teach him. All-in-all very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Reed

customer_reviews.title: Best workbook for phonetic reading
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this book to keep my daughter into her letter sounds and reading simple words. I am a Montessori teacher and I believe this workbook best mirrors what we teach in the classroom. The only thing that I would change is in the book where it tells the parent how to give the lesson I would change not to give the child the letter name (phonetic sounds only) and to refer to the letters as capital letters and lowercase letters instead of big letter and small letter. But other than that this book is the best one I have seen for phonetic reading so far!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: A SIMPLE book has a huge advantage over all the fancy curriculums!
customer_reviews.text: I am so impressed with this book. I have taught 6 children to read before I ran into one who struggled with phonetics. It just wasn't clicking so I needed a book to start over with. I'm so glad I bought this book. 2 weeks into it, it "clicked" , and the child is reading! The book is very, very simple, but colorful and attractive at the same time! The simpleness allows simple learning to go on, while the attractiveness has the child asking for more every day! the lessons are very orderly and the method is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: red roadster

customer_reviews.title: Easy to follow; quick daily lessons
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is 3 and a half. She knows all her letters and the sounds. I thought it was a good time to begin practicing towards reading. We are a few lessons into the book. The lessons are incredibly easy to follow and the perfect length for my toddlers attention span. Sometimes we do only one lesson that takes about 10 minutes, sometimes two or three lessons. The lesson activities change slightly and my daughter enjoys them; they’re cute. User friendly and worth its cost.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Adams

customer_reviews.title: Great starter book, good parent prompts
customer_reviews.text: I love the direct prompts and fun interactive movements to help guide me in the instruction process. We’ve been doing Kumon books for about 5 months and this is a great sidekick. I really wish I had found this sooner and combined it with the writing or did it first. Though I’m grateful my 4 year old seems to like both. Since we do the the Kumon and also the Sylvan books, I’m happy that this one sticks to activities instead of adding tracing to the book since it allows for a more game like book vs just another tracing workbook.
customer_reviews.author: Wifeandmom

customer_reviews.title: Worked for my son!
customer_reviews.text: I have a seven year old autistic son who is a VERY reluctant reader. This book has been my primary resource. At first lessons were hard going, but we kept at it. We are now on lesson 97! At some point reading “clicked” and now he is enjoying himself! He is eager to use this book and he is starting to have a sense of pride in his achievements. I couldn’t be happier- I just wish there was a book 2!
customer_reviews.author: Lydia-Anne Laura Loehr

customer_reviews.title: Not for us
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this.. my son does better with a supplemental online program. There was nothing that made this stand out from all the other new learn to read type books. Was not for us.
customer_reviews.author: J. Pritts

customer_reviews.title: Makes reading easy and fun!
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old started working on this book this summer (2020) because we will be doing remote learning for Kindergarten and I thought it would help to supplement her education. She is reading words so quickly with the help of this book! I love the way it is formatted, introducing basic vowel sounds and pairings and teaching them to slide the sounds together to make words. Great material!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Not so engaging book for my kid.
customer_reviews.text: I tought it was good book for teaching your child how to read. But the first page is to tell the parent how to teach, instructing them on ways to teach, what you should tell your kids, how they should write etc. This is not needed. It is a wasted 1 page. The second page is for the kid to do activity. But the activity was too easy for my 4 years old. To me and my son it was waste off money and time.
customer_reviews.author: enkh

customer_reviews.title: bright and colorful
customer_reviews.text: my 5 year old kid loves this book for its graphics and color, however the book seems to skip from an early introduction to writing letters "tracing" and letter sounds to the more advanced blending and word families...which is great because the letter tracing and sounds are skills my kids has already mastered...my one wish it that they would have split up the "levels" into two workbooks instead of one...
customer_reviews.author: Juliet Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is almost 5 and super hyper! She recognizes some letters but definitely not very well. This book has been so fun for her and she loves the little activities. She actually wants to do page after page and we can do about 4 at a time. This has really helped her to break down reading skills and I think it’s something we can keep reviewing until she fully memorized the letters and sounds!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just activity book - not a go to book
customer_reviews.text: The book is very well-made in term of the robustness and the usage of color throughout the book. However, the book is just like any other activity book - to help children to recognize letter sounds etc. This book is definitely a supplement, not a go to book to help my kids how to read.
customer_reviews.author: Caring Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderfully organized and effective
customer_reviews.text: Very well organized. My daughter has retained each lesson. We do about one a day. This is good for children who already are familiar with the alphabet and are ready to learn to read. For children unfamiliar with the alphabet, more practice activities may be needed than are provided in this book.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah H.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent reading lessons once your child knows the alphabet and the sounds the letters make
customer_reviews.text: We have really enjoyed this book, my son started to read before he turned four, by using this book. I wasn't sure it was going to work, but he knew his alphabet and the sounds letters made and this book did a great job introducing the concept of blending letters. Definitely recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Love it! It has helped tons!
customer_reviews.text: I am so grateful to God that I have found this book. I have a 4 year old daughter who I have been exposing her to phonics for some time now but this book has definitely helped in her reading three letter words. she has read three letter words before but since using this book I have seen tremendous improvement and we're not even halfway through the book. I highly recommend. She can read three letter words much easier now and is blending much better.
customer_reviews.author: Flavio G. Oliveira

customer_reviews.title: We love it
customer_reviews.text: 6yo loves it. We tried several other reading programs, but all were too dry to keep his attention (also, he refuses to sing songs or recite/memorize little poems, which both of the other programs we tried required). This has plenty of colorful little workbook - style activities (which he loves) and relies on verbal instruction from an adult (which he also is fine with).
customer_reviews.author: janbw

customer_reviews.title: Fun learning!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun little activity book. I purchased several activity books and flash cards like this one, to keep my little one "entertained" during summer. Haha he actually loves it and it helps as a refresher, he is learning English and going to 1st grade so learning to read also and this activity book has been very helpful. I get super happy and a bit emotional (proud moment) when he reads over the directions of each activity. Believe me it's a fun book, your kids will enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: Jade

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! This really worked for my 4 yr old daughter. She is actually reading!!! She is reading and putting together cvc words and she knows a few sight words. I used this as a precursor to kindergarten (homeschool) and It has made a huge difference.
customer_reviews.author: The Hitman

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for children beginning to read.
customer_reviews.text: Great book for my 5 yo son. He hates reading and spelling but this book makes it a lot of fun to teach him to read. He loves the activities too and looks forward to our time learning to read. We do like 5 pages at a time. He got it as part of his Christmas gifts. It was in my cart for a while n I just decided to buy it and try it out. Best $10 spent.
customer_reviews.author: Marie O

customer_reviews.title: Working for my kid
customer_reviews.text: Accurate description. Good product, timing. Well packaged. Context, complexity, and order flow very nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Finally, something a mom can use!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd child to learn to read. I’ve done it all. That awful book ...100 Easy Lessons, Hooked on Phonics, etc. And this book is by far the best tool I’ve ever used. I had our book spiral bound at the office store. I recommend doing that. You will not regret your choice to use this book!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: I take 5-10 minutes, 4 days a week, with my 4 year old daughter and do one page of this book. We are on the 30th activity and she is actively sounding word out on cereal boxes and whatnot. I am very impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin

customer_reviews.title: Buy this!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this book so much. It is so entertaining. It's one of the only workbooks my daughter will sit down and do with me every time. I can't recommend this enough. She learned to read very quickly using this book. Buy this!
customer_reviews.author: Meagan

customer_reviews.title: A must buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this book for my 4 yr old toddler to learn how to read. She loved it. They little games incorporated made it fun as well. I will recommend this book to anyone trying to teach their little ones to read.
customer_reviews.author: Denessa Bardell

customer_reviews.title: My 5 year old loves this book
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old loves this book. After he takes a bath every evening we do 2 to 4 pages about every other day. He is always engaged and never complains when I get the book out to go through it.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Beautifully Done
customer_reviews.text: Love the full color pictures! My kids seem to enjoy them as much as they can enjoy a workbook. We use these occasionally to break up there traditional reading program and supplement.
customer_reviews.author: Shelbie

customer_reviews.title: Quality Resource for Early Learners
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this Learn to Read activity book by Hannah Braun! My son has learned so much and thoroughly enjoys the lessons. We finished lesson 59 this morning, so we’re more than halfway through the book! I truly love how open-and-go the lessons are, as well as the progression of concepts and the consistent review. There are additional resources listed in the back of the book that I’m looking forward to exploring as well! Thank you Ms Braun for a quality resource for early learners.
customer_reviews.author: Aubree

customer_reviews.title: Great content and quality!
customer_reviews.text: I love the format and content of this book. I love the repetitive and progressive work. It is easy and my daughter enjoys it. She always asks to start her day reviewing this book. We use it as a warm up book for our homeschool Kindergarten English Language Arts program.
customer_reviews.author: Aarica

customer_reviews.title: I love this book!
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome. I don't see this as just an activity book. This feels more like curriculum and I love it for the price. It's like a more colorful and activity filled version of Teach your child to read in 100 easy lessons.
customer_reviews.author: amaples93

customer_reviews.title: Love Love Love
customer_reviews.text: This book is great! For parents and kids... I bought BOB BOOKS for my son and he just looked at the picture and guessed. This book actually teaches (with my help of course) how to blend sounds together.
customer_reviews.author: Aurora

customer_reviews.title: Very fun and engaging
customer_reviews.text: Very fun and engaging! I love the quality of the book. The pages and pictures are very good. The activities are perfect for my 4 year old. Not too long that she will get bored. Great book!
customer_reviews.author: Nani

customer_reviews.title: 11 out of 10!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing!!! I love this so much! It is great for the classroom, small groups, or one on one! It is so easy to use and straight forward and has wonderful visuals! The perfect introduction as well as practice!
customer_reviews.author: Zoe Isabel

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old loves the activities in this book! Great sound it out activities to learn to read, with the kids out of school it's great having a book that teaches me how to help him learn to read!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Well made book, but poor content
customer_reviews.text: I would not call this an activity book. It's more of a book that you sit down with your child, show them the letters and sound out small words. Very little coloring, drawing, writing and such.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Redundant, not the best.
customer_reviews.text: Thought it had different exercises... it's very redundant with each letter.
customer_reviews.author: Kira

customer_reviews.title: Fun and engaging
customer_reviews.text: My 3.5 year old LOVES the activities in this book. The lessons are quick and fun, just right for her attention span. We aren’t too concerned about how well she’ll be able to actually read by working through the book (the book may accomplish this for older kids just fine, but ours doesn’t always remember letter sounds from one lesson to the next) but she’s gaining a ton of early reading skills and getting excited about learning!
customer_reviews.author: Krista Fantin

customer_reviews.title: Great book! It wont dissapoint! Simple and engaging short activities that promote learning.
customer_reviews.text: I really love this book. Simple short and fun. I use it along with another phonics book in my homeschooling to keep reinforcing reading and keep activities varied. My fast learner 4 year old loves it and my 6 year old first grader who im using it fir review with.
customer_reviews.author: glowinggirl

customer_reviews.title: The child loves it so we do as well.
customer_reviews.text: Just got this but my 5 year old daughter is into it and doing well. Happy parents!
customer_reviews.author: jay

customer_reviews.title: This Book Taught My Three Year Old To Read! Highly Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: This book taught my three year old son to read. No lie. I worked with him almost every morning and by lesson 15 he could read. It was amazing. It took us about three weeks. That being said he did already know his letters and phonics. I recommend this book to anyone trying to teach a child to read. The one thing that absolutely helped was the blending skills. I followed all of the skills and suggestions, but, do NOT skip on the blending.
customer_reviews.author: Jaclyn Dairman

customer_reviews.title: Great for phonics and basic sounding out/ reading!
customer_reviews.text: Loved this book. This was not my first option but everything else seemed out of stock for fast delivery and wanted something to get my son going while school is out due to corona virus. Perfect choice! Exactly what I was looking for to work on phonics and basic reading!
customer_reviews.author: Julie GA

customer_reviews.title: Educational fun
customer_reviews.text: I hope she likes it and is an easy learn for her...she's 3 and soon to start school. The book reminds me of some learning resources I benefited from in learning to read and write. #80sBaby
customer_reviews.author: Purple Sunflower

customer_reviews.title: Great Product and Explanations for Parents
customer_reviews.text: After researching and reading reviews, I purchased this for my granddaughter who is 4. My daughter wanted to work with her at home, and wanted lessons. I am a middle school teacher and was very impressed by the lesson set ups. Easy to use, and my granddaughter is reading some words after just 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: Love2Read

customer_reviews.title: LAMINATE THEM!! BECOME RESUABLE !!!
customer_reviews.text: I love it ! great little lessons to teach your little one . I got the paperback one and just ripped each page and laminated them, whole punched them , placed them In a binder and use dry erase markers ! During these times I had plenty of time to do it :) I just used the amazon basic laminator and amazon basic laminate sheets (100 in pack !) . Worth the money in my opinion if you want to re use them again and again especially if you have other little ones .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I been looking for
customer_reviews.text: Everything I been looking for, I wish I would of found this books much sooner after spending so much money on a well know reading curriculum I purchased in the past. This book is very beautiful and colorful. Specially for my child that gets bored quick. Very easy lessons.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Totally recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Great activity book, such good quality and the activities are fun for my child. 10/10 works great to teach phonics and letters.
customer_reviews.author: Caley Smith

customer_reviews.title: Incredible resource!
customer_reviews.text: Love this curriculum! It is engaging for the student from the first page, full color, and easy to use! We are loving this with our five-year-old!
customer_reviews.author: Rainwink007

customer_reviews.title: Just what i was looking for
customer_reviews.text: This book was absolutely amazing and perfect for my 3 year old. We had done a lot of phonics work before hand and i had started teaching two letter words so we then got his. He is 3.5 and he is reading and sounding out every word in the book we get it. I absolutely love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Laura  Kester

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: It seems a little too easy for my 4 years old. He ran out of this book quickly. But it was always fun to work on!
customer_reviews.author: Licia W.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good book. It help lids to learn words and how to read.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great great great
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old took to this so quickly. He's learning to read, partly on his own! He has been able to recognize letters & has known the sounds for quite sometime. That has helped us zoom through sounds & get right to words.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn T.

customer_reviews.title: Great book for a child who is having trouble learning to read.
customer_reviews.text: This was the first book that really got my daughter to start to read. It emphasizes letter sounds and groups of words that rhyme share certain beginning and ending sounds. It taught her to break down small words into letters, sound them out, and decode the word. This worked much better for her than trying to memorize sight words. I highly recommend this book.
customer_reviews.author: Monty V

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be helping my 5 year old learn to read. The activities are easy to understand and not too long.
customer_reviews.author: superman4905

customer_reviews.title: My daughter has learn English so fast thanks to this book!
customer_reviews.text: For some reason I was looking for a book that would help my daughter with the English reading, i bought different books and for some reason she told me this is her favorite, she finds it fun, simple and she can even do it herself without my help and learn faster since she loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Reading
customer_reviews.text: Had to return it because my niece said that her son was already passed that book.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Domenick

customer_reviews.title: The most loved book for my son
customer_reviews.text: I bought a few highly rated books from Amazon to teach my son how to read. He is a 5 year old boy who doesn't really like to learn how to read, but for some reason, he loved this book the most.
customer_reviews.author: W Mo

customer_reviews.title: Keeps kids’ interest; fun book
customer_reviews.text: Love this. My 5 year old flew threw the entire book in a week or two. It’s easy but she learned a lot.
customer_reviews.author: tracy

customer_reviews.title: Gets my child engaged and has helped in the learning to read experience !
customer_reviews.text: Great book, my 5 year old is starting to learn how to read thanks to this book. She really enjoys the activities and this is her favorite workbook....
customer_reviews.author: Joanna

customer_reviews.title: Great learning tool for children
customer_reviews.text: We are teaching my daughter to read and she loves the activities that go along with that in this book.
customer_reviews.author: The Modern Housewife

customer_reviews.title: Fun lessons and even better customer service!
customer_reviews.text: My son is beginning to learn to read and we just started the book. It offers interesting ideas for how to make lessons fun and also includes a variety of activities. We had some trouble with the binding of the book but as soon as we contacted Doloris, she responded and sent us a new book immediately! Wonderful experience and book.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Short and fun lessons
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to our homeschool K curriculum. My son likes the short lessons.
customer_reviews.author: Wyldmum

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for homeschool preschool
customer_reviews.text: My 4yo loves the activities and they are easy enough for him to grasp the concepts fun enough for him to be bored while going through the activities.
customer_reviews.author: Lionel

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Excellent workbook. Pacing is just right and the activities were all very engaging for my kid.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon johnson

customer_reviews.title: colorful work book
customer_reviews.text: very colorful. Kid does one page per day. A little boring but acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful design
customer_reviews.text: Very good! Already using it with a 4-yr old with great results.
customer_reviews.author: PTDW

customer_reviews.title: Fun activities!
customer_reviews.text: My son is in kindergarten and loves our learn to read book time! Has a lot of great ideas for kids to keep them engaged in the lesson for the day. Fun activities too!
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie J

customer_reviews.title: The best book for teaching kids to read.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic book. I have taught my 4 year old to read from this book.
customer_reviews.author: angi jackson

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Good book for our homeschool - using this with my Kindergartener. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Min

customer_reviews.title: Great for Re enforcement
customer_reviews.text: My kindergartener loves this book. We use it on the weekend to supplement her school work
customer_reviews.author: Bridgette

customer_reviews.title: So great. Wish there was another
customer_reviews.text: I wish there were more books like this. My 4 year old and I cruised through it (200 pages, doing 3-4 pages a night) and he enjoyed it so much without even realizing he can now read simples words and sentences. Now we need a part two for the next steps.
customer_reviews.author: Just_a_Guy

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: 4 yr old uses this to keep her busy, lots of activities to keep her little brain going
customer_reviews.author: natasha ormsby

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: My kiddos are loving this book and so am I!!! I have four little ones. Two five year olds and two four year olds. All of them get excited about learning now!!! Highly recommend. It’s only takes a few minutes everyday and they love the one on one time with mommy.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffani Swain

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect book! This book is a lot of fun and a great addition to our homeschool curriculum!
customer_reviews.author: Angel Rose

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: My five year old loves this book and had made huge steps in letter recognition, letter sound, and is reading her first words and learning to sound out all within a few weeks of nightly use
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Hoecherl

customer_reviews.text: My daughter has loved learning with this book and its simple for me as a parent to instruct with
customer_reviews.author: CEO Hiatt

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Great supplement book to teaching alphabets. Pages are pretty and engaging
customer_reviews.author: Seven Wonders

customer_reviews.title: Right on for the child
customer_reviews.text: This book my kid , He had fun lerning with me
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great 1st Book to Teach your 4/5 year old how to start reading
customer_reviews.text: I do not typically leave reviews but I wanted to share how impressed I am with this book. It is a great choice to start teaching your 4 or 5 year old how to read. Lessons are manageable (10-20 min) for the parent and fun for the child. Plus it really works to teach your child how to read. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Merkulov

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this book! Used it over the summer for my 5 year old who was starting Kinder. She had fun doing it and it helped with her reading.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Potter

customer_reviews.title: Great tool to have in our toolbox
customer_reviews.text: Totally tailored for my kiddo. These are fun we can do 3-5 lessons in 20 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Tobehonest

customer_reviews.title: Good nook so far
customer_reviews.text: So far we love it. My son was excited to open it up. We are using it in conjunction with some other learning resources so we've only done one page so far but it went well.
customer_reviews.author: Angelina

customer_reviews.title: Activities are not fun
customer_reviews.text: It’s easy to follow but activities are not that fun.
customer_reviews.author: Ophie87

customer_reviews.title: Learn to read
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! Gives teaching tips and fun little activities. My son is really learning how to read using this book.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for my 4 and 2 year old
customer_reviews.text: My four and almost two year old are loving it! My four year old has now been reading three letter words and the almost two year old is sounding out her letters ❤️ Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Xtine

customer_reviews.title: Nice and fun way to learn
customer_reviews.text: Preordered the book and not dissapointed so far. Nice and fun way to learn.
customer_reviews.author: Havelock

customer_reviews.title: Enjoying
customer_reviews.text: My Kindergarten granddaughter is enjoying working her way through this book
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Kenworthy

customer_reviews.title: Best learn to read book!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best book for teaching littles how to read! The lessons are short and sweet and the book breaks down exactly how to teach each lesson.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah J.

customer_reviews.title: Help Our Children Grow
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book for one of my grandsons. His Mom tells me it was a useful tool.
customer_reviews.author: Linda L.
